channel.title: CVE Feed for AMD -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for AMD -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-20583|2023-08-01T18:00:43.783Z -- amd -- processors
item.description: A potential power side-channel vulnerability in AMD processors may allow an authenticated attacker to monitor the CPU power consumption as the data in a cache line changes over time potentially resulting in a leak of sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2023-20556|2023-08-08T17:14:24.974Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof
item.description: Insufficient validation of the IOCTL (Input Output Control) input buffer in AMD μProf may allow an authenticated user to send an arbitrary buffer potentially resulting in a Windows crash leading to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20560|2023-08-15T21:08:47.904Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20master
item.description: Insufficient validation of the IOCTL (Input Output Control) input buffer in AMD Ryzen™ Master may allow a privileged attacker to provide a null value potentially resulting in a Windows crash leading to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20521|2024-02-13T19:26:44.526Z -- amd -- athlon%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics%20%E2%80%9Cpicasso%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: TOCTOU in the ASP Bootloader may allow an attacker with physical access to tamper with SPI ROM records after memory content verification, potentially leading to loss of confidentiality or a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20598|2023-10-17T13:26:21.731Z -- amd -- radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%205000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: An improper privilege management in the AMD Radeon™ Graphics driver may allow an authenticated attacker to craft an IOCTL request to gain I/O control over arbitrary hardware ports or physical addresses resulting in a potential arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20520|2023-05-09T18:53:42.276Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Improper access control settings in ASP Bootloader may allow an attacker to corrupt the return address causing a stack-based buffer overrun potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20561|2023-08-08T17:14:53.405Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof
item.description: Insufficient validation of the IOCTL (Input Output Control) input buffer in AMD μProf may allow an authenticated user to send an arbitrary address potentially resulting in a Windows crash leading to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20594|2023-09-20T17:27:59.742Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%E2%80%9D
item.description: Improper initialization of variables in the DXE driver may allow a privileged user to leak sensitive information via local access.

item.title: CVE-2023-20589|2023-08-08T17:04:17.854Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors
item.description: An attacker with specialized hardware and physical access to an impacted device may be able to perform a voltage fault injection attack resulting in compromise of the ASP secure boot potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20566|2023-11-14T18:54:00.908Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper address validation in ASP with SNP enabled may potentially allow an attacker to compromise guest memory integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-20531|2023-01-11T07:01:59.843980Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient bound checks in the SMU may allow an attacker to update the SRAM from/to address space to an invalid value potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20527|2023-01-11T07:01:59.843980Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Improper syscall input validation in the ASP Bootloader may allow a privileged attacker to read memory out-of-bounds, potentially leading to a denial-of-service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20570|2024-06-04T17:20:10.498Z -- amd -- alveo%E2%84%A2%20card%20%28ultrascale%E2%84%A2and%20ultrascale%2B%E2%84%A2%20based%29
item.description: Insufficient verification of data authenticity in the configuration state machine may allow a local attacker to potentially load arbitrary bitstreams.

item.title: CVE-2023-20593|2023-07-24T19:39:41.259Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: An issue in “Zen 2” CPUs, under specific microarchitectural circumstances, may allow an attacker to potentially access sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2023-20592|2023-11-14T18:54:13.255Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper or unexpected behavior of the INVD instruction in some AMD CPUs may allow an attacker with a malicious hypervisor to affect cache line write-back behavior of the CPU leading to a potential loss of guest virtual machine (VM) memory integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-20571|2023-11-14T18:55:02.307Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics%20%20%E2%80%9Ccezanne%E2%80%9D
item.description: A race condition in System Management Mode (SMM) code may allow an attacker using a compromised user space to leverage CVE-2018-8897 potentially resulting in privilege escalation.

item.title: CVE-2023-20526|2024-02-13T19:26:55.266Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20processors%20%E2%80%9Ccolfax%E2%80%9D
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the ASP Bootloader may enable a privileged attacker with physical access to expose the contents of ASP memory potentially leading to a loss of confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2023-20530|2023-01-11T07:01:59.843980Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient input validation of BIOS mailbox messages in SMU may result in out-of-bounds memory reads potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20588|2023-08-08T17:06:30.065Z -- amd -- epyc%E2%84%A2%207001%20processors
item.description: A division-by-zero error on some AMD processors can potentially return speculative data resulting in loss of confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2023-20567|2023-11-14T18:51:25.340Z -- amd -- radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%205000%2F6000%2F7000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper signature verification of RadeonTM RX Vega M Graphics driver for Windows may allow an attacker with admin privileges to launch AMDSoftwareInstaller.exe without validating the file signature potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20525|2023-01-11T07:01:59.843980Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient syscall input validation in the ASP Bootloader may allow a privileged attacker to read memory outside the bounds of a mapped register potentially leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20533|2024-02-13T19:27:07.661Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%22
item.description: Insufficient DRAM address validation in System Management Unit (SMU) may allow an attacker to read/write from/to an invalid DRAM address, potentially resulting in denial-of-service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20564|2023-08-15T21:07:49.838Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20master
item.description: Insufficient validation in the IOCTL (Input Output Control) input buffer in AMD Ryzen™ Master may permit a privileged attacker to perform memory reads/writes potentially leading to a loss of confidentiality or arbitrary kernel execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20529|2023-01-11T07:01:59.843980Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient bound checks in the SMU may allow an attacker to update the from/to address space to an invalid value potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20568|2023-11-14T18:51:35.466Z -- amd -- radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%205000%2F6000%2F7000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper signature verification of RadeonTM RX Vega M Graphics driver for Windows may allow an attacker with admin privileges to launch RadeonInstaller.exe without validating the file signature potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20587|2024-02-13T19:32:33.392Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper Access Control in System Management Mode (SMM) may allow an attacker access to the SPI flash potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20569|2023-08-08T17:02:11.318Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors
item.description: A side channel vulnerability on some of the AMD CPUs may allow an attacker to influence the return address prediction. This may result in speculative execution at an attacker-controlled address, potentially leading to information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2023-20586|2023-08-08T17:05:16.338Z -- amd -- radeon%E2%84%A2%20software%20crimson%20relive%20edition
item.description: A potential vulnerability was reported in Radeon™ Software Crimson ReLive Edition which may allow escalation of privilege. Radeon™ Software Crimson ReLive Edition falls outside of the security support lifecycle and AMD does not plan to release any mitigations

item.title: CVE-2023-20528|2023-01-11T07:01:59.843980Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the SMU may allow a physical attacker to exfiltrate SMU memory contents over the I2C bus potentially leading to a loss of confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2023-20565|2024-02-13T19:27:26.573Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics%20%20%E2%80%9Ccezanne%E2%80%9D
item.description: Insufficient protections in System Management Mode (SMM) code may allow an attacker to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

item.title: CVE-2023-20532|2023-01-11T07:01:59.843980Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the SMU may allow an attacker to improperly lock resources, potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20524|2023-05-09T18:54:00.877Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: An attacker with a compromised ASP could possibly send malformed commands to an ASP on another CPU, resulting in an out of bounds write, potentially leading to a loss a loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-20573|2024-01-11T13:53:52.581Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: A privileged attacker can prevent delivery of debug exceptions to SEV-SNP guests potentially resulting in guests not receiving expected debug information.

item.title: CVE-2023-20597|2023-09-20T17:32:18.969Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%E2%80%9D
item.description: Improper initialization of variables in the DXE driver may allow a privileged user to leak sensitive information via local access.

item.title: CVE-2023-20519|2023-11-14T18:53:36.329Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: A Use-After-Free vulnerability in the management of an SNP guest context page may allow a malicious hypervisor to masquerade as the guest's migration agent resulting in a potential loss of guest integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-20558|2023-04-02T18:49:20.069507Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series
item.description: Insufficient control flow management in AmdCpmOemSmm may allow a privileged attacker to tamper with the SMM handler potentially leading to an escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2023-20523|2023-01-11T07:01:59.843980Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: TOCTOU in the ASP may allow a physical attacker to write beyond the buffer bounds, potentially leading to a loss of integrity or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20562|2023-08-08T17:13:50.810Z -- amd -- %CE%BCprof
item.description: Insufficient validation in the IOCTL (Input Output Control) input buffer in AMD uProf may allow an authenticated user to load an unsigned driver potentially leading to arbitrary kernel execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20563|2024-02-13T19:27:18.318Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics%20%20%E2%80%9Ccezanne%E2%80%9D
item.description: Insufficient protections in System Management Mode (SMM) code may allow an attacker to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

item.title: CVE-2023-20522|2023-01-11T07:01:59.843980Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient input validation in ASP may allow an attacker with a malicious BIOS to potentially cause a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-20575|2023-07-11T18:29:02.607Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: A potential power side-channel vulnerability in some AMD processors may allow an authenticated attacker to use the power reporting functionality to monitor a program’s execution inside an AMD SEV VM potentially resulting in a leak of sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2023-20559|2023-04-02T18:49:20.069507Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series
item.description: Insufficient control flow management in AmdCpmGpioInitSmm may allow a privileged attacker to tamper with the SMM handler potentially leading to escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2023-20579|2024-06-04T17:20:09.206Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics
item.description: Improper Access Control in the AMD SPI protection feature may allow a user with Ring0 (kernel mode) privileged access to bypass protections potentially resulting in loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20596|2023-11-14T18:55:14.665Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics%20formerly%20codenamed%20%E2%80%9Ccezanne%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Improper input validation in the SMM Supervisor may allow an attacker with a compromised SMI handler to gain Ring0 access potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20555|2023-08-08T17:07:24.476Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient input validation in CpmDisplayFeatureSmm may allow an attacker to corrupt SMM memory by overwriting an arbitrary bit in an attacker-controlled pointer potentially leading to arbitrary code execution in SMM.

item.title: CVE-2023-31347|2024-02-13T19:18:51.045Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Due to a code bug in Secure_TSC, SEV firmware may allow an attacker with high privileges to cause a guest to observe an incorrect TSC when Secure TSC is enabled potentially resulting in a loss of guest integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-31346|2024-06-04T17:19:15.832Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to initialize memory in SEV Firmware may allow a privileged attacker to access stale data from other guests.

item.title: CVE-2023-31320|2023-11-14T18:51:43.415Z -- amd -- radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%205000%2F6000%2F7000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Improper input validation in the AMD RadeonTM Graphics display driver may allow an attacker to corrupt the display potentially resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-21979|2024-06-04T17:37:40.519Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-21972|2024-04-23T16:36:03.933Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-2193|2024-03-15T21:25:07.075Z -- amd -- cpu
item.description: A Speculative Race Condition (SRC) vulnerability that impacts modern CPU architectures supporting speculative execution (related to Spectre V1) has been disclosed. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability to disclose arbitrary data from the CPU using race conditions to access the speculative executable code paths.
